title: Participate in an Academic Survey to Reflect on your Freelancing Experience – DR139 - Upwork
description: Hello, you are being requested to take part in a survey of 25 - 30 minutes for academic research purposes. Once you begin the survey, you have up to 72 hours to complete it, beyond which time the survey platform will mark your responses as incomplete. Please pay attention to all the questions.    Since many established resources for employees such as organizational support or supervisors do not apply to freelancers, this study intends to help freelancers with strategies to have a better freelancing experience on Upwork or other comparable platforms. We will use your answers to guide new and experienced freelancers on building their profiles on labor platforms like Upwork and managing their freelancing career, as well as suggest improvements to the platforms and to policymakers. If you are interested, we can provide you with a brief summary of our major findings from our completed research study once our research is complete (tentatively August 2025 or earlier), after contacting you via Upwork. We welcome freelancers across experience levels, earnings, and ratings who: (i) provide freelancing services on their own (not as part of an agency or company), (ii) are over 18 years of age, (iii) have provided freelancing services for more than 1 year on Upwork, (iv) have worked on freelancing projects in the past 1 year on Upwork (consider July 2022-June 2023 as the past 1 year), and (iv) have a Job Success Score on their profile. If you meet all the criteria listed above, please respond to this online survey job posting only if you consent to participating in this survey and allowing us to use certain details from your public Upwork profile for statistical purposes. Procedure: In this survey you will not have any more risks than you have in normal life. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. You will not be personally identified in our analysis or reporting. While storing the data from the survey, a participant ID number will be used instead of your name. However, we will collect some information from your public Upwork profile with your consent (e.g., ratings, job category, total earnings, number of jobs, number of successfully completed jobs and jobs in progress, hourly rate, pricing strategy (fixed vs. hourly), profile title and keywords, number of reviews, type of recognition badge, number of years of educational and work experience, number of skill tags, country, gender, job success score, availability of  portfolio, testimonials, certifications, availability badge, and profile video) to understand the difference in freelance experience. Profile information that is captured from your public profile on Upwork with your consent, will be depersonalized for data analysis and reporting so that it is not identifiable with your details and will only be recorded against your participant ID number. These details and your responses will be kept confidential and used for academic purposes only. This study has been approved by the researchers' institutional research ethics board. Data will be stored in a secure academic database on university-licensed cloud storage to ensure confidentiality. Please use a laptop or tablet to complete the survey. We recommend not using mobile. Compensation: You will receive $8 for your participation. Kindly note, you will be compensated upon completion of the entire interview as per standard Upwork processes. At the end of the survey, you will be provided with a random ID number (numerical code) that will need to be shared with us on Upwork Message. This will enable us to process your compensation via the Upwork platform, as per standard Upwork processes. You can stop participating in the survey at any time. You may skip the questions, where applicable or use the ‘Not applicable or NA’/‘Not sure’/‘Prefer not to disclose’ options, or even close the browser to end the survey. While we hope that you will complete the survey, we will compensate you for the first milestone for partial completion of the survey. Your Upwork profile will not be adversely impacted in any way with your participation in the survey, even if you choose to terminate the survey midway as we will provide a 5-star rating without feedback upon completion to preserve the research integrity. Survey time: Approximately 25-30 minutes. The actual time may vary. Location: The survey will be conducted virtually, via an online survey platform and will begin only after you provide your consent. Frequency: One-time Consent: We will seek your consent electronically at the start of the online survey regarding: • Consent to participate • Consent to record non-personal information from your public profile without personally identifying you in the data. Please respond to the online survey job posting once you agree with ALL the above requirements. If you have any more questions, you can contact the primary researchers through Upwork Message.Skills: SQLite, Realm Database, MongoDB, MySQL, Apache Cassandra, API, Database, Database Architecture, Software Architecture & Design, Data Access Layer, RESTful API, PHP Script, Python Script, SOAP API, Business Logic Layer, Database Maintenance, Ruby, C++, ASP, Django, SaaS, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Atlassian Bamboo, AWS Amplify, Azure DevOps

description: property at 25 Rowe Street, the following key points should be considered in order to draft a plan for an architect: 1. Zoning and Development Guidelines: The property is zoned as Rural Residential with a requirement for onsite effluent disposal due to the lack of reticulated sewer. The Structure Plan for the area needs to be in compliance with the local planning scheme and the outlined density requirements. 2. Effluent Disposal Capability: The site has been assessed for onsite effluent disposal capability, and the plan should incorporate provisions for individual ATUs and absorption beds for effluent treatment. 4. Water Supply: The property does not have access to mains potable water supply, so each dwelling must be equipped with water tanks for rainwater harvesting. The design should include adequate roof catchment area and tank capacity. 5. Site Conditions: Consider the topography, soil types, and groundwater levels on the site to inform the design of the dwellings and infrastructure. 6. Heritage and Environmental Considerations: Ensure that no heritage sites are impacted, and any environmental assets are protected or appropriately integrated into the design. 7. Servicing and Utilities: Plan for extension of power and telecommunication services to the dwellings, as well as the provision of access roads and emergency services access routes. 8. Design Guidelines: Develop design guidelines for the proposed dwellings, including considerations for solar orientation, water-sensitive urban design, and sustainable building practices. By incorporating these key considerations into the design plan, you can create a comprehensive and compliant proposal for the development of the property at 25 Rowe Street. Consideration of Surrounding Environment: As the property is located in Margaret River, known for its natural beauty, it is important to design the project in a way that enhances the surrounding area and fits harmoniously within the environment. In preparing the brief for the property at 25 Rowe Rd W with 6 ancillary dwellings, it is essential to address these key points and ensure that the design proposal aligns with the regulations and guidelines of the Margaret River council. title: Add Matter protocol to existing home automation software - Upwork
description: I am looking for a skilled programmer who is proficient in C#, .Net, CSS, HTML, and JavaScript to help me develop a software application. The project is just starting and I have a detailed list of specific requirements and features for the application. Ideal Skills and Experience: - Strong proficiency in C#, .Net, CSS, HTML, and JavaScript - Experience in developing software applications - Ability to understand and implement detailed requirements - Strong problem-solving skills - Attention to detail and ability to write clean, maintainable code 1. Scope of the project. You will be adding new functionality to an existing product called Big6 plug-in for home automation software HomeSeer.com. Description of Big6 is available here http://big6.ivanv.com As you can see Big6 supports 6 protocols. The task at hand is to add another protocol called Matter. Matter is a new protocol for home automation supported by Google, Amazon and many others. Here is a general description of the Matter protocol https://csa-iot.org/newsroom/peeking-under-the-hood-of-your-matter-smart-home/ Well developed SDK and API do exist for easy programming. Look here for example https://developers.home.google.com/matter/overview You will be doing for HomeSeer similar work to the work others did for Home Assistant. Take a look here https://github.com/home-assistant-libs/python-matter-server HomeSeer.com does have it's own SDK as well that you can see here https://github.com/HomeSeer/Plugin-SDK If you are successful adding Matter to Big6 than we will consider hiring you long term to do maintenance of Big6. 2. Get familiar with the environment (takes 15 min) Download and install homeseer.com home automation software (free trial) Go to Plugins--Manage--Add and add Big6 plug-in Activate Big6 plug-in Go to Plugins--Big6--Profiles Cofiguration Create new HTTP GET profile as follows Name: Test URL: https://randomuser.me/$input The word input must be in curly brackets not allowed here Log box: checked leave everything else blank at this profile page and save it In HomeSeer go to "Events" tab Create new event as follows Name: Test1 Trigger: Manualy triggered Action: Big6HTTP (select it from the drop down box) Profile: Test (the one that you just created) Message box: blank Input box: api Save and run the event. Go to the log at Tools--Log and see the data that you received from executing the event Go to Devices and select Floor: Big6 and Room: HTTP See a new device named Test that Big6 has created. With this simplified experiment you managed to send data out and to receive data in over HTTP using Big6. Furthermore Big6 created HomeSeer device automatically to hold the information received for further use. The project at hand here is to send data out (control) and receive data in (status) to Matter enabled devices in compliance with Matter protocol. Since Matter enabled devices need to be adopted first within Big6  "fabric" than developing this functionality is also part of the job. As far as Matter rides on top of TCP and UDP and as far as both TCP and UDP are supported by Big6 now, than no work is expected at lower levels than the application layer. 3. Deliverables and testing New tab in Big6 profiles "Matter" with similar functionality as the other profiles. The new profile page will have everything necessary to setup a Matter profile. Unlimited number of Matter profiles will be allowed The new profile page will have all the fileds nececessary to parse input and create HomeSeer devices (similar to the lower part of HTTP profile). It will support all functionality such as expressions in the fields. New item Big6Matter will show up in Event Actions drop down menu New Big6Matter action will open additional fields as needed for the action New ! Functionality to adopt Matter enabled device. You will wrap your code per HomeSeer requirements for a new plug-in and produce .zip file I will upload the file and create new stand alone plug-in called "Matter" for testing purposes. I do have Matter enabled devices. Your product must be able to adopt the Matter devices and than control the devices and finally receive status information from devices and process it in a similar fashion as the other Big6 supported protocols (profiles). If all of the above works satisfactory than I will give you access to Big6 code to incorporate your code into Big6. The project will be considered completed after that, and payment due for the project. 4. Maintenance. We request  that you provide 6 months maintenance and bug fixing.  It will be paid as part of the project costs. 5. Privacy and confidentiality We will ask you to sign Non disclosure agreement and IP protection agreement and to keep your work and all materials that you receive from us private and confidential. We will own the code after we pay for it and you will not disclose it  to anyone without our permission.Skills: .NET Framework, C#, JavaScript

title: Upgrade to SailsJS v1.5.7 in NodeJS Application with Enhancements in Code Quality and Testing - Upwork
description: I'm looking for someone with extensive experience in SailsJS to assist with upgrading an older project from Sails v0.12.14 to v1.5.7 (https://sailsjs.com/documentation/upgrading/to-v-1-0). This project is a small order system featuring an Angular frontend and an iOS client app. The upgrade involves a comprehensive refactor and requires a smooth transition to the upgraded system. Key tasks include adding API tests, ensuring code compatibility with Node 18, and addressing the following specific requirements identified in a preliminary code review/checklist: 1. Utilize Tern or similar for thorough code analysis to identify potential issues. 2. Address modifications made to `app.js` for compatibility with the latest Sails version. 3. Transition from using large controllers to adopting actions2 controllers, impacting 16 controllers. 4. Convert 16 services into Sails helpers for improved architecture compliance. 5. Convert existing `helpers.js` into Sails helpers format. 6. Refactor custom methods in models, which are deprecated in Sails v1. 7. Eliminate bad Sails practices, such as using `sails.emit` in user land code. 8. Update policy file names to adhere to Sails v1 recommendations. 9. Relocate content from the `static` folder to `assets` to comply with the updated structure. 10. Transition from `connections.js` to `datastores.js` for database configurations, aligning with Sails v1 standards. 11. Adopt the latest release of the Waterline ORM for optimized data access and manipulation. 12. Ensure compatibility and performance with the latest version of Node. 13. Implement API testing to ensure reliability and stability. 14. Conduct thorough testing of the frontend and iOS client app throughout the upgrade process. 15. Introduce linting and set up a GitHub action to run lint checks after every push, enhancing code quality. 16. Security audit to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities. 17. Considerations for improving observability and error detection through enhanced logging. We're looking for a candidate with strong skills in SailsJS and its ecosystem. This project mainly involves upgrading and refactoring the SailsJS backend. Familiarity with Angular and experience in iOS app development would be a significant advantage. These additional skills are appreciated as they help ensure the entire order system integrates smoothly after the upgrade. Additionally, the candidate should have a solid background in testing and be adept at using static code analysis and other tools to ensure code quality. We expect applicants to demonstrate previous successful SailsJS projects, highlighting their approach to maintaining high code standards.Skills: Sails.js, Node.js, Web Application, JavaScript, MongoDB, NGINX, ExpressJS, API

title: ATS system development..  - Upwork
description: Creating an Applicant Tracking System (ATS) involves developing a comprehensive software application that helps organizations manage their recruitment process more efficiently. It requires a multi-disciplinary approach, incorporating various technical skills and tools. When hiring someone to make an ATS software, you've already identified several essential skills. However, to ensure a robust and scalable ATS, you may consider expanding the list of required skills and areas of expertise. Here is a more detailed list to help you find the right candidate or team: - Technical Skills and Knowledge 1. Python for Backend Development: Including experience with web frameworks (e.g., Django, Flask) for rapid development and deployment. 2. Natural Language Processing (NLP): For resume parsing, job matching, and enhancing search functionalities. Knowledge in libraries such as NLTK, spaCy, or transformers is essential. 3. Pandas and NumPy: For data manipulation and analysis, crucial in handling the large volumes of data an ATS system will process. 4. Frontend Development: Knowledge in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks/libraries like React.js, Angular, or Vue.js for building a user-friendly interface. 5. Backend Development: Besides Python, familiarity with other backend technologies like Node.js, Ruby on Rails, or PHP could be beneficial for certain integrations or specific use cases. 6. Database Management: Proficiency in database technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, or SQL Server for data storage, retrieval, and management. 7. API Integration: Experience with integrating third-party APIs (LinkedIn, job boards, social media, etc.) and building custom APIs for various services within the ATS. 8. DevOps and CI/CD Pipelines: Knowledge in continuous integration and continuous deployment using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or GitHub Actions to streamline development workflows. 9. Cloud Services: Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) for hosting, scalability, and storage solutions. 10. Security and Compliance: Understanding of web security best practices (OWASP standards) and data protection laws (e.g., GDPR) to ensure the ATS is secure and compliant. 11. Containerization and Orchestration: Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, or similar technologies for containerization and efficient deployment. 12. User Authentication and Authorization: Knowledge of implementing secure login systems and managing user permissions. 13. Software Testing: Proficiency in automated testing frameworks for backend (pytest, unittest) and frontend (Jest, Selenium) to ensure reliability and performance. Additional Considerations - UI/UX Design: While not a primary development skill, understanding the principles of user interface and user experience design is crucial for building an ATS that is both efficient and pleasant to use. - Project Management: Skills in project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum) could be beneficial for overseeing the development process and ensuring timely delivery. - Understanding of Recruitment Processes: Familiarity with HR processes and challenges can guide the development to be more aligned with end-user needs. - Scalability and Performance Optimization:  Ability to design systems that can scale efficiently and perform under high load, considering future growth. When drafting the job description or the project brief, clearly outlining these skills and specifying any particular technologies or methodologies you prefer will help attract candidates who are well-suited for developing a comprehensive ATS system. title: DevOps/Cloud Engineer for VPC Setup - Upwork
description: Job Description: We're seeking a DevOps or Cloud Engineer proficient in AWS, Terraform, and GitHub Actions to set up our cloud infrastructure and automate our deployment process. The project involves configuring a VPC with a load balancer that has a static IP, restricting access to pre-approved hosts, and automating the deployment of a Node API from a Turbo repository package. Key Tasks: AWS VPC Setup: Design and implement a secure, efficient AWS VPC environment specific to our project's requirements. Load Balancer Configuration: Set up a load balancer within the VPC with a static IP or IP range, ensuring it allows connections only from designated hosts. CI/CD Pipeline Automation: Utilize Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC) and GitHub Actions for continuous integration and deployment. The pipeline should automate the deployment of our Node API from a Turbo repository package. Access Control and Security: Implement strict access controls and security measures within the AWS environment to protect our resources and data. Ideal Skills: Expertise in AWS services, especially VPC, EC2, and Load Balancers. Strong experience with Terraform for infrastructure management and GitHub Actions for CI/CD pipelines. Experience in deploying Node APIs, preferably with knowledge of Turbo repository packages. Solid understanding of network security principles and access control in a cloud environment. Application: Please reach out with a brief overview of your experience with Terraform, GitHub Actions, AWS VPC configurations, and deploying Node APIs. Include examples of projects where you've implemented similar setups. While a formal resume isn't required, details that demonstrate your expertise and ability to handle this project are welcome.Skills: Business with 10-99 Employees, DevOps, Amazon Web Services, CI/CD, Docker, Deployment Automation, CI/CD Platform, Kubernetes, Application Release Automation

title: DevOps Instructor, TSR Learning LLC - Upwork
description: Job description TSR Learning is a leading provider of technical training and education solutions, specializing in cutting-edge technologies and methodologies. We are committed to empowering individuals and organizations with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in the ever-evolving world of technology. Our mission is to bridge the gap between industry demand and skill supply, and we are looking for a passionate DevOps Instructor to join our team. Position Overview: As a DevOps Instructor at TSR Learning, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of our students and helping them acquire the skills and expertise needed for success in the DevOps field. You will be responsible for delivering high-quality training and mentoring, ensuring that our students gain a deep understanding of DevOps concepts, tools, and best practices. Key Responsibilities: 1. Course Delivery: - Conduct engaging and informative classroom or online training sessions on DevOps principles, practices, and tools. - Develop and update course materials, including presentations, hands-on labs, and assignments. -  Record Instructional Materials to be Reusable for our online training sessions on DevOps programs. 2. Mentorship and Support: - Provide individualized guidance and support to students, helping them grasp complex DevOps concepts. - Offer assistance and clarification on course-related questions and projects. 3. Assessment and Evaluation: - Create and administer quizzes, exams, and assessments to evaluate student progress. - Provide constructive feedback on assignments and projects to promote skill development. 4. Stay Updated: - Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and DevOps best practices. - Continuously update course content to align with industry standards. 5. Collaboration: - Collaborate with other instructors and curriculum developers to enhance the quality of our training programs. - Participate in curriculum planning and development meetings. 6. Student Engagement: - Foster a positive and interactive learning environment. - Encourage student participation and discussion in class. 7. Administrative Tasks: - Maintain accurate records of student attendance, performance, and feedback. - Assist in the scheduling and coordination of training sessions. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, IT, or related). - Proven experience working as a DevOps Engineer or in a similar role. - In-depth knowledge of DevOps principles, tools, and methodologies. - Excellent communication and presentation skills. - Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities. - Experience with teaching, mentoring, or training is a plus. - Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Docker Certified Associate) are desirable. DevOps Tool Stack =============== - Azure Cloud - AWS Cloud - Terraform - Ansible - Docker - Kubernetes - GitHub Actions - Npm - Python - Prometheus - Grafana - Linux - Git & GitHub - Apache TomCatSkills: Microsoft Azure, Education, Cloud Computing, Apache Tomcat, Web Server, Python, Bash, Linux, Amazon Web Services, Docker, Git, Ansible, Jenkins, DevOps, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana

title: Eyes as controller: Creating SDL2 mapping based on Eye tracker API - Upwork
description: We are seeking an experienced developer with a strong background in API integration, game development, and specifically, experience with SDL2 and eye-tracking technologies. The goal of this project is to integrate an eye tracker API with SDL2, utilizing AntiMicroX to map eye movements to keyboard and mouse actions, transforming eye movements into a game controller. This innovative approach aims to provide an intuitive and immersive gaming experience. AntiMicroX - https://github.com/AntiMicroX/antimicrox//wiki/Adding-A-New-Game-Controller-Mapping-under-AntiMicroX ---- Project Details: Objective: Develop a seamless integration between an eye tracker API (yet to be developed) and SDL2, leveraging AntiMicroX for mapping eye movements to conventional game controls. Technology Stack: Eye Tracker API: A Python-based script will be developed to capture and transmit eye movement data in real time, including direction (left, right, up, down, diagonal) and velocity parameters. SDL2: Utilizing the SDL Game Controller API for sensible default gamepad controls and ensuring a plug-and-play experience for users. AntiMicroX: Integration with AntiMicroX to map eye tracker outputs to keyboard and mouse actions, facilitating a unique control scheme for gaming. Responsibilities: Develop the integration layer between the eye tracker API and SDL2, ensuring real-time responsiveness and accuracy of control mappings. Configure AntiMicroX to create a universal profile that can interpret eye movement as game controller inputs, compatible with various game genres. Requirements: Proven experience with Python, SDL2, and API integration projects. Familiarity with game development and understanding of game controller APIs. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on technology integration challenges. Excellent communication skills to collaborate with team members and provide regular updates. Please submit your application along with: A brief introduction about yourself and your experience with similar projects. Examples of previous work related to API integration, SDL2, or game development. Your approach to solving the challenges presented in this project. Estimated timeline and budget for project completion. We are excited to embark on this innovative project and look forward to your application. Let’s create a groundbreaking gaming experience together!Skills: C++, API, C, C#, Visual Basic for Applications

title: QA Automation Engineer (MERN Stack) - Upwork
description: Position: QA Automation Engineer for a MERN + TypeScript Web Application Location: Remote Type: Full-Time Payment: Always on time! We are seeking a seasoned QA Automation Engineer with a strong background in the MERN stack to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a key member of our Development and Quality Assurance team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality software products by leveraging advanced test automation frameworks and SaaS tools. Our ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a remote, collaborative environment and is passionate about solving complex challenges to improve our application's reliability and performance. Responsibilities: - Develop and enhance test automation frameworks to support our MERN stack applications, ensuring high-quality product delivery. - Design and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases for functional, regression, acceptance, and performance testing. - Provide real-time visibility into tests as they run, enabling on-demand execution and easy access to past test results and failure recordings. - Ensure test logic is easily verifiable and maintainable, with a clear interface for reviewing test cases and associated code. - Work closely with the development team to identify and resolve defects and improve overall software quality. - Contribute to daily stand-ups (9am New York time), sprint planning, and retrospectives, ensuring continuous communication and collaboration within the team. Research and recommend SaaS solutions for test automation to enhance efficiency and visibility across the QA process. Qualifications: - Got 5+ years in the QA automation arena? Solid. Experience with MERN (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js) or something similar? Even better. - If you know your way around JIRA and XRay, you're speaking our language. - Proficiency in developing and debugging automated test cases using tools like Cypress, Selenium, or similar frameworks. - Experience with SaaS platforms for test automation such as Katalon Studio, BrowserStack, or similar tools. - Strong understanding of CI/CD principles and experience with tools like GitHub Actions. - Excellent analytical skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex software issues. - Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodologies and participation in all phases of the software development lifecycle. - Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Nice to have: - Jenkins - Implement, maintain, and improve CI/CD pipelines to facilitate seamless integration and delivery of code changes. - Experience in setting up and maintaining local and remote test environments. - Ability to design and implement test strategies for microservices and distributed systems. - Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). - Knowledge of cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their integration into the CI/CD pipeline applied to automatic testing. Working with us: - A fully remote work environment with flexible hours. - An actual collaborative and supportive team atmosphere. - Participation in daily stand-ups and an agile working culture. - Opportunities for professional growth and development. About Grapevine: - Grapevine connects small-large Healthcare practices and businesses directly to the source so they can access low prices, seamlessly purchase from curated vendors, and eliminate supply shortages. _______________________________________ ***In order to be considered, please send us a video link for the first question in the application. - Tell us a bit about yourself. Keep it short and casual, 1-3 minutes. We will not consider you without a video link. - What type of system/dashboard would you deploy in order for us to have an interface where we can run tests on demand, see results of previous tests etc? - You will be given a project where you can start from 0 creating your testing system. How do you organize it? Explain it to us in high level language. - If you will be considered for this job, you will be required to pass a take-home test task and participate in an interview. Are you ok with that ?Skills: End-to-End Testing, Integration Testing, Load Testing, Regression Testing, Stress Testing, Performance Testing, Compatibility Testing, Component Testing, Test Automation Framework, Automated Testing

This app will manage sales, inventory, and customer interactions. **Requirements:** - Experience in web app development, especially POS systems. - Proficiency in front-end: HTML5, CSS3, TypeScript (React preferred). - Strong back-end skills: Node.js, Express, and database management (MySQL or PostgreSQL). - Familiarity with RESTful APIs, payment gateway integration, and PCI compliance. - Problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or within a team. **Nice to Have:** - Cloud platform experience (AWS, Azure, GCP). - Agile development familiarity. - GitHub & GitHub Actions experienceSkills: TypeScript, React, SQL, PostgreSQL, ExpressJS, SaaS, Web Development, SaaS Development

title: Full stack JavaScript Developer (React, NodeJS, GraphQL, TypeScript, MongoDB, AWS) - Upwork
description: We are a Houston-based remote-friendly startup building software to help guide difficult conversations in healthcare. We’re looking to hire a full stack javascript developer to help in our nationwide expansion. About the product: Every day across the US somebody’s grandmother, grandfather, mom, dad or other loved one ends up getting end-of-life medical care that they don’t want (ventilation, dialysis, etc) while others don’t receive all of the care that they do want, especially in disadvantaged communities. Our core product is a web-based platform implemented by leading healthcare systems, insurers and hospitals to help guide patient decision making around their end-of-life care, ensuring that everyone gets the care that they want and deserve. Tech Stack: Our platform is built on top of modern libraries like ReactJS, NodeJS, GraphQL, TypeScript and MongoDB. While we don’t expect you to be a master of all of these technologies, we’re seeking somebody with confidence in their own technical ability to get up to speed quickly. We’re looking for: - 5+ years of software engineering experience in a professional setting - Experience building production apps using React and NodeJS - Ability to be an individual contributor that can work the full stack to build new features - Fluent english As a plus: - Experience working on small teams at seed or pre-seed startups - Experience working with TypeScript, MongoDB, GraphQL (Apollo) - Experience with AWS/ DevOps (Docker, Fargate, Terraform, GitHub Actions, etc) - Experience building enterprise-grade B2B or Healthcare applications ** To apply, include the following three items: ** 1. To have your application considered, please type "Advance Directive" at the very top of your cover letter. 2. Also, if you can, please provide a link to you github profile. 3. Choose ONE of the following questions and provide a brief (1-3 sentence) answer: What are your favorite tools and/or packages to use when working with GraphQL? What is your favorite UI Library/Kit for React? Why? What is your favorite developer tool? (ie: I like the TSLint plugin for VS Code because ____________.) Thanks!Skills: Node.js, Amazon Web Services, MongoDB, JavaScript, React, TypeScript, GraphQL
